nodes.bodyText: ❓ The two different logoutMessage == null checks return different responses. Why an error for the other and not here?

I wasn't sure what to do here. In the sendLogoutRequest method, buildLogoutResponse("some message") is returned in error cases. In the soapLogoutRequest method, Response.serverError().build() is returned in error cases.
What do you think would be the best to return in these 2 places?

I had to look how those endpoints are used again. sendLogoutRequest is the logout action endpoint where we redirect users for a SAML logout, so it makes sense to return a redirect. soapLogoutRequest is the SLO endpoint which is where the SAML IdP sends LogoutRequests, and returning a redirect to the IdP doesn't make sense.
All that to say I think it's fine like you have it 😄
❓ Why static (same question for the build logout response methods)?
That's just a style preference. I like using static for helper methods because it indicates that no instance variables are being used.
I know we didn't do it before but we should verify that encodedSamlRequest != null here
